Publications

Group highlights

At the end of this page, you can find the full list of publications.

A genome-wide CRISPR screen identifies DPM1 as a modifier of DPAGT1 deficiency and ER stress

Using inhibitory drugs, we perform two cell-based screens with CRISPR technology to determine which genes are important under DPAGT1 inhibition. We then used a living fly, that models DPAGT1-CDG in the eye, in order to determine which of the top screened genes can improve its impaired eye development. Surprisingly, we found that inhibiting other CDG-causing genes, such as our top hit Dpm1, could improve our DPAGT1-CDG cell and fly models.

Hans M. Dalton, Raghuvir Viswanatha, Roderick Brathwaite Jr., Jae Sophia Zuno, Alexys R. Berman, Rebekah Rushforth, Stephanie E. Mohr, Norbert Perrimon, Clement Y. Chow

PLOS Genetics (2022)

Decoupling of Apoptosis from Activation of the ER Stress Response by the Drosophila Metallopeptidase superdeath

Using Drosophila, this study provides evidence that superdeath is a link between stress in the ER and activation of cytosolic apoptotic pathways.

Rebecca A. S. Palu, Hans M. Dalton, Clement Y. Chow

Genetics (2020)
